adk.selectorswitch

Class SelectorSwitch

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • adk.selectorswitch.SelectorSwitch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback

    public class SelectorSwitch
extends android.view.View
    SelectorSwitch is a UI component for android (5.0+) inspired by the ACTIVE DYNAMICS PANEL found in most of the McLaren road cars. A SelectorSwitch has this structure.

    The user can rotate the rotary knob around a dial to select the various modes. The developer can choose to have anywhere from one to eight modes in the switch's dial and each mode has to have a name and a colour.

    The names and colors for the modes can be provided in form of string-array and array resources respectively. These resources are then linked to the switch's XML code in the layout file via the :modes and the :colors attributes respectively.

    If no modes or colors are specified, or if only either one of them is specified, or if both of them are specified but their lengths are unequal the SelectorSwitch will use the default modes DEFAULT_MODES and the DEFAULT_DIAL_COLORS.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void animateKnob(float rotateBy)
      Rotates the knob by a specified angle and animates the rotation.
      int getCurrentMode()
      Returns the mode the switch is currently in.
      java.lang.String getCurrentModeName(int index)
      Returns the name of the mode at the specified index.
      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDialColors()
      Returns the list of colors used for the modes in the dial.
      private void initComponents()
      Initialises the structural properties of various parts of the selector switch which include the base, the dial and the knob.
      private void initModesAndColors(android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
      Initialises the modes and colors for each mode from the resource references in the component's XML code from the layout files.
      protected void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
      Draws the 3 main selector components onto the canvas.
      protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec, int heightMeasureSpec)
      Calculates and sets the dimensions of the view.
      void selectMode(int newMode)
      Selects the specified mode in the switch and rotates the knob to point to the specified mode.
      void setColorForDialMode(int modeIndex, int color)
      Updates the color and the paint for an individual mode in the dial, indicated by its index, and redraws the view.
      void setDialColors(int startingColor, int endingColor)
      Updates the colors used for the modes and re-initialises the paints which will be used to draw the modes.
      void setDialColors(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> dialColors)
      Updates selectorDialColors for the selector dial and redraws the view.
      void setModeCount(int count)
      Updates the total number of modes in the selector switch and blends in the current starting and ending color to create new colors for the new intermediate modes (if any).

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectorSwitch

        public SelectorSwitch(android.content.Context context)
               throws IllegalSelectorException
        Initialises all the parameters of the selector switch. First obtains a screen density and then initiates the modes and colors to default values by calling initModesAndColors(AttributeSet), followed by call to initComponents() to initialise the main components - the knob, the dial and the base.
        Parameters:
        context - Context The context used to get the screen's density.
        Throws:
        IllegalSelectorException

      • SelectorSwitch

        public SelectorSwitch(android.content.Context context,
                      @Nullable
                      android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
               throws IllegalSelectorException
        Initialises all the parameters of the selector switch. First obtains a screen density and then initiates the modes and colors by calling initModesAndColors(AttributeSet) ,followed by call to initComponents() to initialise the main components - the knob ,the dial and the base.
        Parameters:
        context - Context The context used to get the screen's density.
        attrs - AttributeSet The attributes obtained from the component's XML in the layout file.
        Throws:
        IllegalSelectorException - If the the number of modes and the number of colors provided are not equal.

    • Method Detail

      • initModesAndColors

        private void initModesAndColors(android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
                         throws IllegalSelectorException
        Initialises the modes and colors for each mode from the resource references in the component's XML code from the layout files. Unless both the modes and colors are specified default values will be used.

        Throws an illegal selector exception if there isn't a color for each mode.

        Parameters:
        attrs - AttributeSet The attribute set obtained from the XML of the switch in the layout file.
        Throws:
        IllegalSelectorException - If the the number of modes and the number of colors provided are not equal.
        See Also:
        Context.obtainStyledAttributes(AttributeSet, int[]), SelectorUtil

      • initComponents

        private void initComponents()
                     throws IllegalSelectorException
        Initialises the structural properties of various parts of the selector switch which include the base, the dial and the knob. Also initialises the paints used to draw these parts on the canvas.

        Uses a few utility static methods provided in SelectorUtil class.

        Throws:
        IllegalSelectorException - If the the number of modes and the number of colors provided are not equal.
        See Also:
        SelectorDial, SelectorKnob, SelectorUtil

      • onMeasure

        protected void onMeasure(int widthMeasureSpec,
                         int heightMeasureSpec)
        Calculates and sets the dimensions of the view. The component is padded by an additional padding space on top of the padding specified in the component's XML code in the layout.
        Overrides:
        onMeasure in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        widthMeasureSpec - int : Width
        heightMeasureSpec - int : Height

      • onDraw

        protected void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Draws the 3 main selector components onto the canvas. Gets the required parameters and angles from the respective components.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas : The canvas to be drawn upon.
        See Also:
        SelectorKnob, SelectorDial

      • setDialColors

        public void setDialColors(int startingColor,
                          int endingColor)
        Updates the colors used for the modes and re-initialises the paints which will be used to draw the modes. Finally redraws the view.
        Parameters:
        startingColor - int : The starting color for the first mode.
        endingColor - int : The ending color for the mode.

      • setColorForDialMode

        public void setColorForDialMode(int modeIndex,
                                int color)
        Updates the color and the paint for an individual mode in the dial, indicated by its index, and redraws the view. Does nothing if the index of the mode is not valid.
        Parameters:
        modeIndex - int : The index of the mode whose color has to be updated.
        color - int : The new color of the mode.

      • getDialColors

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getDialColors()
        Returns the list of colors used for the modes in the dial.
        Returns:
        selectorDialColors

      • setDialColors

        public void setDialColors(@NonNull
                          java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> dialColors)
        Updates selectorDialColors for the selector dial and redraws the view.
        Parameters:
        dialColors - List : The new list of colors.

      • setModeCount

        public void setModeCount(int count)
                  throws IllegalSelectorException
        Updates the total number of modes in the selector switch and blends in the current starting and ending color to create new colors for the new intermediate modes (if any). Updates the selector dial's colors redraws the view.
        Parameters:
        count - int : The new count of total modes in the switch.
        Throws:
        IllegalSelectorException

      • selectMode

        public void selectMode(int newMode)
        Selects the specified mode in the switch and rotates the knob to point to the specified mode.
        Parameters:
        newMode - New mode to select.
        See Also:
        animateKnob(float)

      • animateKnob

        private void animateKnob(float rotateBy)
        Rotates the knob by a specified angle and animates the rotation.
        Parameters:
        rotateBy - float The angle to rotate the knob by.
        See Also:
        SelectorKnobAnimator
